DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to prior use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases relating pertaining to the health issues of women.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to prior use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases relating pertaining to the health issues of women.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor including neo-adjuvant chemotherapy for their clear cell ovarian cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient received prio

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor other than for the treatment of uterine carcinosarcoma within the last three years?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor other than for the treatment of ovarian, fallopian tube or primary peritoneal cancer within the last three years?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior chemotherapy for endometrial cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor other than for the treatment of uterine leiomyosarcoma within the last three years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received more than one previous regimen of chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently undergoing treatment (primary or consolidation) for Stage II, III, or IV ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor (other than ovarian, fallopian tube and primary peritoneal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients who have had prior systemic therapy or radiotherapy for stage III or IV epithelial ovarian, fallopian or primary peritoneal carcinoma

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor within the last five years?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor other than for the treatment of ovarian, fallopian tube or primary peritoneal cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior chemotherapy for any abdominal or pelvic tumor within the last three years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive prior therapy (including chemotherapy, biologic/targeted therapy and immunotherapy) for treatment of endometrial cancer?
